talk.author: did:plc:anrpcemiqwbb3j4rh7pt5t2x
talk.utter: I gotta ask - what was this about?

talk.author: did:plc:5njjm4zcfrwcs6zzzassxsvw
talk.utter: Joseph Addai is a running back drafted by the Colts in 2006. A significant portion of Colts fans didn’t like him and thought he was bad. The opposing view, which I took is that his skill set near ideal for Indy’s offense and critiques of his ability as a runner were about aesthetics not results.

talk.author: did:plc:anrpcemiqwbb3j4rh7pt5t2x
talk.utter:
That's amazing - I was a pretty big Colts fan (not big enough apparently), and I thought he was a pretty darn reliable RB who did great with the Colts system

(Also will always remember him for taking in the final TD of the AFC Championship Game that year)

talk.author: did:plc:anrpcemiqwbb3j4rh7pt5t2x
talk.utter:
That's amazing - I was a pretty big Colts fan (not big enough apparently), and I thought he was a pretty darn reliable RB who did great with the Colts system

(Also will always remember him for taking in the final TD of the AFC Championship Game that year)

talk.author: did:plc:5njjm4zcfrwcs6zzzassxsvw
talk.utter: A good bit of it was just being an offshoot of the great battle over statistical analysis in football. Addai was exactly the kind of runner undervalued by the anti-statgeeks. “He dances too much, his YPC is bad.”But he was fantastic as a blocker/receiver and consistently made positive plays running.

talk.author: did:plc:5njjm4zcfrwcs6zzzassxsvw
talk.utter:
It’s actually really wild/lucky they were able to get the closest guy to an Edge James replacement right away and with a late 1st.

It was the Peyton Manning show so a back great in the pass game who’d feed Peyton 2nd and manageables was perfect

talk.author: did:plc:5njjm4zcfrwcs6zzzassxsvw
talk.utter: It got very online drama tho, another mod (brother of the site manager) on the SBNation Colts site deleting each others posts and all that

talk.author: did:plc:anrpcemiqwbb3j4rh7pt5t2x
talk.utter: That is amazing | I'm glad I never got involved in sports social media, that would have been so much more intense than chemistry social media

talk.author: did:plc:anrpcemiqwbb3j4rh7pt5t2x
talk.utter: That is amazing | I'm glad I never got involved in sports social media, that would have been so much more intense than chemistry social media

talk.author: did:plc:5njjm4zcfrwcs6zzzassxsvw
talk.utter: There are a lot of places hardened posters cut their teeth but sports blogs were a really common one. Sports are maybe the best generator of content to argue about out there
